versions.correctionNotice: A minor error was identified in tables REC1 and REC2, in the Public Sector Finances released at 09:30am on 21st September 2016. A processing error led to the publication of incorrect data for 2014 for series ANRS and associated series ANRV, JW34 and JW38 which are derived from ANRS. These series have now been corrected. We apologise for any inconvenience.

A minor error was identified in table REC2 in the Public Sector Finances released at 09:30am on 21st September 2016. A processing error led to the publication of incorrect data for 2015/16 for series ANRS and associated series ANRV, ANSI, ANSL, ANSV, ANSY, JW34 and JW37 which are derived from ANRS. These series have now been corrected leading to revisions to tables REC1, PSA10 and Public Sector Finances borrowing by sub-sector, in 2015/16. Measures of net borrowing, net cash requirement and net debt are unaffected by these changes.  We apologise for any inconvenience.

A minor error was identified in table PSA6E in the Public Sector Finances released at 09:30am on 21st September 2016. A processing error led to series NMDL being published with the incorrect signage. Series NMDL has now been corrected leading to revisions to tables PSA6C (NMDL) and PSA6E (series MHA8, MF6R, MF6S and MF6U which are derived from NMDL). Measures of net borrowing, net cash requirement and net debt are unaffected by these changes. We apologise for any inconvenience.

A minor error was identified in table PSA9 in the Public Sector Finances released at 09:30am on 21st October 2016. A processing error led to the level of gilts held by the Bank of England Asset Purchase Facility Fund (APF) being overstated by £11.0 billion. Gilts held by the APF which reached maturity in September 2016 were not recorded as redeemed leading to the assets of the APF being overstated and, correspondingly, public sector net debt understated. As a result of correcting this error, public sector net debt at the end of September 2016 (Series HF6W) has increased by £11.3 billion or 0.6 percentage points of GDP (Series HF6X). Due to the removal of interest payments to the APF related to these gilts, the public sector net borrowing (Series -J5II) in September 2016 has increased by £18 million and public sector net cash requirement (Series JW38) in September 2016 has increased by £221 million. Tables PSA1, 2, 3, 4, 7A, 8D, 9 and REC1 have been updated to reflect the corrected dataset. We apologise for any inconvenience.

description.title: Public Sector Finances Tables 1-10: Appendix A
description.summary: The data underlying the Public Sector Finances statistical bulletin are presented in the tables PSA 1 to 10.
description.metaDescription: The data underlying the Public Sector Finances statistical bulletin are presented in the tables PSA 1 to 10.
